positionHistory.title: Head of Process, Methods, Tools & Continuous Improvement
positionHistory.description:
Designed, implemented, led full management process system of Quality department & improvement projects.
Unit management (4 people - engineers & technicians). 

2 main roles within my function:
1- 'Process, Methods and Tools' role [Implementation and maintenance of processes] - 2 people (1 people and myself)
2- 'Continuous Improvement' role [Management and control of process implemented] - 3 people

Key achievements:
※ Gave back strong authority to Quality Gate Review process applicable between 2 workstations. Made decision process more reliable by defining accurate operations flow, forms structure and content, information system and binary acceptance criteria for each station. Trained and coached each function until working independent.

※ Decreased from 30% to 5% risk to not rework properly defective parts on vehicles. Analysed failures on current defect recording paper form. Wrote rework process and implemented a new form in Excel format fitting exactly to rework process. Defined exactly roles and responsibilities by function within organization. Trained and coached all stakeholders.

※ Reduced control detection failure from 30% to 1% in incoming inspection by implementing a new method of checking vehicles and parts. Designed, tested and validated standard control document in PowerPoint format providing a framework with exact flow and content of checks to be performed.

positionHistory.title: Head of Operations Quality
positionHistory.description:
Managed Assurance Quality Team for shopfloor and improved process, methods & tools used for work execution. Unit management (6 people - engineers & technicians).

Key achievements:
※ Suspended customer stop delivery decision result from major claim about painting defect on carbody. Anticipated customer legal requirements by creating a measurement campaign on all produced vehicles to contain risk and defective vehicles. Conducted collection of technical knowledge on subject, determined measurement method and way to test and validate it. Organized and led measurement campaign until report measurement delivery.

※ Removed production bottleneck by improving 1st pass yield from 20% to 90% on 2 critical process steps regarding vehicles physical measures operations. Practised daily measures with all operators to identify and analyse gaps between ways of working. Defined, tested and validated best common way of working and consolidated know-how in detailed and non-interpretable Word documents. More people trained and skills upgraded.

※ Increased problem solving success rate from 10% to 90% in production by implementing a binary and step-by-step guided method to conduct problem solving at workstation. Wrote operating sequence, simple and logical questions to ask the stakeholders to structure and channel thoughts and answers. Trained and coached people until self-sufficiency.

positionHistory.title: CAPA process leader
positionHistory.description:
Implemented ‘Corrective Action & Preventive Action’ process as site process owner. Adapted and designed methods, tools, trainings, information system.

Key achievements:
※ Set and stabilized average processing time at 48 hours for non-conform products by implementing Quality Clinics for sensor manufacturing and customer returns. Defined and set up premises, visual management, measurement tools, traffic and storage tools dedicated to non-conform products. Designed information system in Excel format, all process flowcharts, operating documents and documentary tools for processing non-compliant products.

※ Led study to define a reliable solution reducing from 3% to 0.1% failure rate to make an error or omission during parts mechanical assembly. Conducted detailed map process (SIPOC) and deep failure analysis with business experts. Standardised and made reliable the way to find an industrial solution meeting identified needs by dividing each need into elementary function. Best solution found with full confidence.

※ Secured likelihood to find a true root cause within a controlled time frame in a context of major customer claim with complex technical issue. Anticipated 8D difficult to manage due to poor problem description by customer, lack of data and consequently many hypotheses to test. Built a specific 8D meeting frame in Excel format to master meetings sequence, collect and analyse data, keep people focused on each chronological step. Facilitated 8D progress by maintaining a permanent, regular, efficient and controlled work rhythm.

positionHistory.title: Process Improvement Manager
positionHistory.description:
Designed & led improvement plans about recurrent critical failures for manufacturing and design area.

Key achievements:
※ Identified root cause of historical main failure of sensor manufacturing. Practiced a deep dive immersion on daily work with operators all along manufacturing process. Mapped entire process (SIPOC), analysed all potential failures (FMEA) in team with business experts and tested all hypotheses in decreasing order of credibility until reaching the right hypothesis.

※ Eliminated risk of delivering non-compliant sensors to customers by analysing and correcting devices measuring 12 critical electrical and physical features certifying product conformity. Designed and wrote standard method and documentation to perform easily an measurement system analysis. Tested this standard in real-life situations by carrying out first test campaign upon devices with direct customer impact.

※ Reduced defect rate on a cable cutting station from 2% to 0.1%. Led process mapping (SIPOC) and conducted meticulous failure analysis (FMEA) with operators, technicians and engineers owning knowledge and experience at this workstation. Defined and prioritised clear needs to remove failure cause. Tested and validated each solution with Methods Engineer support and fully documented.

Faisant preuve d'un relationnel développé, son contact naturel et spontané et son ouverture d'esprit ont toujours permis à Alexandre de gagner la confiance et l'adhésion de ses interlocuteurs opérationnels. company.name: Liebherr Group
company.description:
Established in 1949, the Liebherr Group today is not only one of the biggest construction equipment manufacturers in the world, but also offers high-quality, user-oriented products and services in many other areas. The family-run technology company employs nearly 50,000 people in over 140 companies worldwide.
Liebherr’s product range includes the segments Earthmoving, Deep Foundation Machines, Mobile and Crawler Cranes, Tower Cranes, Concrete Technology, Material Handling Technology, Mining, Maritime Cranes, Aerospace and Transportation Systems, Gear Technology and Automation Systems, Refrigeration and Freezing, Components as well as Hotels in Ireland, Austria and Germany.
The Group’s parent company is Liebherr-International AG located in Bulle, Switzerland, which is entirely owned by members of the Liebherr family. 
Career possibilities can be found online: https://www.liebherr.com/en/deu/career/career.html

Imprint: https://www.liebherr.com/en/deu/disclaimer/imprint.html

Kommunikativ, agil, menschlich, unterstreichen meine Führungspersönlichkeit, stets auf Wirtschaftlichkeit, Effektivität, Qualität, Sicherheit und die Umwelt bedacht. Über einen regen Austausch und das Netzwerken hier bei LinkedIn freue ich mich sehr und stehe für Fragen und Auskünfte gerne zur Verfügung. 

Christian Brunner

Ability to work cross functionally and managing Teams.

Both reflexive character and reactivity to make fast decisions when necessary.

2003.- Best Quality Management Brand at Renault Powertrain Plant, while working as powertrain assembly line production manager.

Strategy and goals definition:
•	Participate in the strategy and goals meetings with the Hierarchy.

Commitment & continuous improvement:
•	Encourage creativity to increase the amount of applicable Quality improvement ideas.
•	Lean activity over the control plan.
•	Benchmarking on other plants quality organization.

Team members Skills and career development management:
•	Skill matrix.
•	Delegation to Quality Engineers, recognition to high performance and reward accomplishments.
•	Rule the Management By Objectives yearly interview with the Quality Engineers.

Quality meetings, listening and feedback:
•	Daily briefing with the Quality Engineers.
•	Rule the daily Department quality circle meeting (QRQC). Workshop managers presenting problem solving in standard tools.
•	Present on the Department monthly Key Goals Meeting, (Department high-level information, goals achievement on going & get feedback from the Team Leaders and operators.

Product & Process change management:
•	Support PEP with SQA, Engineering and Purchase.
•	Audit the start of production after a long stop or intervention, to release the series production.

Audits:
•	Internal audits conducted.
•	External audits to maintain certification supported.

Problem solving management:
•	8D reports elaboration for customer issues and assessment the ones from suppliers.
•	Coaching in problem solving tools to Quality and Production, using standard tools (5 Why, QC Story, PDCA, DMAIC, Is/Is not, Pareto, Ishikawa, Brainstorming, Histogram, basic statistics, Scatter diagram, design of experiments, 6 sigma).
•	Present Quality analysis to the board of Directors.

Supervise daily work and monitor Team performance.

company.name: ROLEX
company.description:
The leading brand in Swiss luxury watches, Rolex enjoys an unrivalled reputation for excellence, performance and prestige. Pioneer of the wristwatch since 1905, the brand is at the origin of landmark innovations in watchmaking, including the first waterproof wristwatch - the Oyster - and the Perpetual rotor self-winding mechanism.

Its watches have accompanied explorers and achievers around the world, from the top of the highest mountains to the deepest reaches of the ocean.

Rolex is also actively involved in supporting the arts, sports, exploration, the spirit of enterprise through a broad palette of sponsoring activities and philanthropic programmes.

company.name: ETH Zürich
company.tagline: ETH Zurich – Where the future begins 🚀🔬
company.description:
ETH Zurich – Where the future begins

Freedom and individual responsibility, entrepreneurial spirit and open-mindedness: ETH Zurich stands on a bedrock of true Swiss values. Our university for science and technology dates back to the year 1855, when the founders of modern-day Switzerland created it as a centre of innovation and knowledge. At ETH Zurich, students discover an ideal environment for independent thinking, researchers a climate which in-spires top performance. Situated in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, ETH Zurich is pioneering effective solutions to the global challenges of today and tomorrow.

Some 530 professors teach around 20,500 students – including 4,100 doctoral students – from over 120 countries. Their collective research embraces many disciplines: natural sciences and engineering scienc-es, architecture, mathematics, system-oriented natural sciences, as well as management and social sci-ences. The results and innovations produced by ETH researchers are channelled into some of Switzer-land’s most high-tech sectors: from computer science through to micro- and nanotechnology and cutting-edge medicine. Every year ETH registers around 90 patents and 200 inventions on average. Since 1996, the university has produced a total of 380 commercial spin-offs. ETH also has an excellent reputation in scientific circles: 21 Nobel laureates have studied, taught or researched here, and in international league tables ETH Zurich regularly ranks as one of the world’s top universities.

company.tagline: Smart consulting, enhanced medical solutions.
company.description:
At Congenius, we offer tailored medical technology consultancy services in the fields of Quality, Regulatory, eHealth, Operations and Clinical. Our goal is to enable the smartest route to enhanced medical solutions. 

Together with our customers, we stimulate informed ideas, create lasting solutions, and inspire positive change. We provide tailored expertise and leadership to global firms, established SME`s and aspiring start-ups in the medical device, in vitro diagnostics and pharmaceutical industry. By reassuring our customers through knowledge and experience we form trusted partnerships that facilitate the successful registration and delivery of medical devices. 

If you`re a customer looking for support with your next challenge, please feel free to get in touch via our website, or by sending our CEO Jörg Dogwiler a message – we look forward to speaking with you. 

As our customer base and service portfolio continue to develop and grow, we also welcome applications from experienced candidates looking to join our dynamic organisation. If you enjoy working with a diverse range of people across a broad range of projects and are passionate about making a positive contribution to the medical technology industry, then a role as a Congenius Consultant could be your next rewarding career step. Take a look at our job postings for our available roles.

company.name: DISCH AG
company.tagline: 120 years leader in development and production of solid galenic formulations such as lozenges, soft chews and gummies
company.description:
Disch AG has, founded in 1903, specialized for 120 years in the production of hard-boiled lozenges, toffees and pastilles (gummies).

DISCH established itself as a pioneering company in functional confectionery when in 1933, it brought out the well-known «Sportmint» - the first nutraceutical product in history. The refreshing toffee with added vitamin C was a novelty, combining for the first time, a delicious taste in a pleasant chew with the intake of a vitamin. Nutraceuticals were born.

Being since then a leading CDMO in confectionery technology, today we focus on the production of pharmaceutical products (OTC) and dietary supplements for customers around the globe. We develop according to our customers' specifications and produce in Switzerland on modern lines according to recognized standards such as GMP.

In 2023 we launched for the first time in 40 years own branded DISCH products again. Our premium toffees "Swiss fruit" are functional soft chews of highest quality and with an amazing taste. The range is still to grow.

DISCH AG – Innovation meets perfection!

educationHistory.description: Oriented in applied optics

Microengineering is the art and science of creating, designing, integrating and manufacturing miniature components, instruments and systems.

The main characteristic of this domain is its multidisciplinary nature ; a microengineering system integrates electronic and mechanical elements with computational, chemical and optical elements, as well as with various materials. Furthermore, a device's manufacturing aspects are as important to microengineering as it function.

Le Cours de mathématiques spéciales (CMS) est le cours préparatoire de l'EPFL pour les étudiants qui n'ont pas les titres requis pour être admis dans une des formations bachelor de l'EPFL. Il donne les bases requises par de telles formations en mathématiques, physique, chimie et biologie.

person.headline: Senior Director Carlsberg Excellence  at Carlsberg Group

positionHistory.title: Senior Director Carlsberg Excellence
positionHistory.description:
Design and roll out a global global continuous improvement program, now called Carlsberg Excellence, focusing on delivering long term cultural transformation and sustainable efficiencies. The program is based on four main areas of work: 
- Drive long term sustainable efficiencies through a well balance Continuous Improvement program anchored on TPM ( Total Productive Management) framework but including elements of LEAN, 6 sigma and HPO.
- Enable the development of Self Motivated and Autonomous working teams focusing on constant and in-depth capability building programs at all levels. 
- Fast Paced Continuous Improvement focusing on delivering short term bottom and top lines goals. Gross savings priorities are defined based on a global loss tree and OEE improvement focused programs to capacity constrained lines.
- Drive the Smart Brewery project aiming to accelerate adoption of new work process through digitization, capability building via self paced learning tools and productivity gains with real time performance management at shop floor and enabling autonomous teams to make decisions based on real time insights from granular machine performance data and advanced analytics.

company.name: Carlsberg Group
company.tagline: Brewing for a better today and tomorrow
company.description:
This is the official LinkedIn channel of the Carlsberg Group.

The Carlsberg Group was established in 1847 by brewer J.C. Jacobsen. J.C. Jacobsen was a true renaissance man. A believer in quality, research and serving the community, he shared his knowledge with fellow brewers. He looked to the future, prizing long-term growth over short-term gain.

Today, Carlsberg Group is one of the leading brewery groups in the world, with a large portfolio of beer and other beverage brands. Our beer portfolio spans core beer brands, including local power brands and international premium brands, craft & speciality brands and alcohol-free brews.

Our brands are enjoyed in more than 150 markets across Western Europe, Asia and Central & Eastern Europe, and we hold a number 1 or 2 position in more than 20 markets.

We strive to brew better beers, today and tomorrow. Doing business responsibly and sustainably supports that purpose – and drives the efforts to deliver value for both our shareholders and the society.

Learn more on www.carlsberggroup.com

We post about beer, so please only follow if you are of legal drinking age, and forward to those of legal drinking age only. #Celebrateresponsibly. See our house rules: https://bit.ly/2Kx73f7
